intro: Crepis willdenowii subsp. willdenowii, commonly known as the narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to central and eastern Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and often have a fuzzy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming in clusters. It is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
